title: Research Interests
content: My research interests lie in Usable Security and Privacy and Human-Computer Interaction. I am particularly interested in understanding users’ and developers’ privacy perceptions, needs, expectations, and behaviors. I am also passionate about evaluating and designing experiences that make complex systems accessible to users.

title: Failure Resume
content: failure sucks. but, despite it sucking so much, failure has taught me a lot about myself: how resilient i am, how far i need to go and, sometimes, how i’m exactly where i need to be. and so, welcome to a list of my professional and personal failures, rejections, and disappointments. started at 2021.

things.content: Rejected by a lot of companies for internship hunting
things.reflection: Every interview is a way to communicate with senior developers and know where I am

things.content: Got 'C' in math and cs courses
Failed to be promoted to the ministerial position of the Student Union.
Rejected by the International Legal Talent Program.
Rejected by the legal debate team in the second-round interview.
Rejected by the Wu Yuzhang Honors College in Sichuan University.

title: Research
content: Research projects I have worked on (in reverse-chronological order)

items.title: When Privacy Notices Matters: Investigating the Impact of Timing on the Salience of Smartphone App Privacy Notices
Plains Cree Typing Tool Evaluation
items.description: Plains Cree is a low resource language, Indigenous to Canada. This language is at risk of being lost so we have collected a corpus of language materials to enable the creation of language technologies.

items.title: Comparative Study of Concurrent Feedback Types for Flight Simulator Training
Research on the Supervision of Off-Campus Curriculum Subject-Tutoring Institutions under “Double Reduction” Policy: An Analysis from the Perspective of Law
items.description: This project systematically analyzes the social practical needs of discipline after-school training institutions and the governance ideas and means of local administrative supervision departments in promoting the implementation of policies. On the basis of reflecting on the current practical practice of improper administrative supervision, this paper examines the shortcomings of the legalization of administrative supervision from the perspective of law.
